result.execSummary:
On one or more charges in this case, Jason C Jones was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Sworn and Testified: Tewana Marshall (Case Manager) & Leland Schams III (DOC Agent). Court takes judicial notice of report submitted. Court FINDS State has met their burden and ORDERS Defendant REVOKED from placement on  conditional release. Defendant REMANDED to Mental Health institute FORTHWITH. Defendant Jason C Jones in court with Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Defendant Jason C Jones in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in Court for Hearing regarding Conditional Release. Court is in receipt of Dr. Rawski's Report dated June 4, 2018. Sworn to testify: Dr. Robert Rawski.    
For reasons stated on the record, Court finds that the Defendant is a candidate for Conditional Release. The Defendant was committed to the Department of Health Services (DHS) on May 16, 2017.  
Court orders DHS and the 51.42 Board of Milwaukee County prepare a plan that identifies the treatment and services that the Defendant will receive in the community; the Defendant's needs for supervision, medication, community support services, residential services, vocational services, and AODA treatment; who will be responsible for providing the treatment and services identified in the plan.  
The plan to be presented to the Court within 60 days. Order for Conditional Release Plan; signed by the Court and filed. Copies provided to the parties.  
Court orders case adjourned for Conditional Release Plan hearing in Branch 18.  Hearing scheduled for July 30, 2018 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jason C Jones in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Defendant Jason C Jones in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. The Court found the defendant not guilty by reason of mental disease/defect on 11/14/2016.  Parties review the reports prepared on 5/8/2017 and 5/10/2017. Defense contests the findings. Sworn for defense: Doctor Robert Rawski. Defendant made statements. Due to testimony and reports, Court adopts the findings and orders the following placement:
- Institutional care.  Sheriff shall transport the defendant to the mental health institute designated by DHS, forthwith, for a period of 3 YEARS. DHS is authorized to administer psychotropic medication or treatment to the defendant and shall observe appropriate medical standards in doing so. Discussion of credit placed on the record. Court grants 125 days credit. Court orders case adjourned for Status Conference to discuss further credit days. If parties stipulate, no appearance necessary as long as stipulation provided to the Court.

Filed; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form.

Defense motion to increase level of Justice Point supervision, not objected to by the State.  Court orders defendant to be monitored by Justice Point for level 3 supervision, including mental health services.  

Case remains scheduled for Hearing on 12-14-2016 at 1:30 pm in Branch 18.

Defendant Jason C Jones in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Phase I proceeded.  
As to count 1:  Defendant advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.

Phase II of special plea proceeded.
Sworn for the defense: Dr. Robert Rawski.  Court took judicial notice doctor's report dated 9-23-2016.  Defense and state rests.  Arguments heard.  The Court finds that the defendant was able to appreciate the wrongfulness of his acts but as a result of the defendant's mental disease was unable to conform his conduct to the requirements of the law.  The Court finds the defendant NOT GUILTY BY REASON OF MENTAL DISEASE/DEFECT.  The Court has concerns if he should be committed or if he can reside in the community under a Conditional Release Order.  The Court ordered a Supplemental Mental Examination.  The defendant will be examined on an out-patient basis.  Order for Predisposition Investigation signed and filed.  Case adjourned to Branch 18.  Hearing scheduled for December 14, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jason C Jones in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case in court for return on doctors report.  Parties do not contest findings, which state that there is evidence the defendant suffered from a mental disease or defect on the date of the offense.  There is also data that he lacked substantial capacity to understand the wrongfulness of his acts.  Defense requests to set case for NGI plea and court trial.  Case adjourned to Branch 18.  Court trial scheduled for November 14, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jason C Jones in court with Attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Defendant Jason C Jones in custody.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for return on doctor's report.  Doctor's Report received and filed.  Doctor's report read by parties.  Parties do not dispute the findings and Court reinstates the proceedings.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Information given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty by reason of mental disease.  Defense counsel informs the court that he believes that the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Defense entered a plea of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect.
Court ordered Dr. Robert Rawski be appointed to examine the defendant for NGI and competency pursuant to Wisc. stats.  971.16 and 971.14(2).   Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  The Court set bail at $500 signature bond with TURNOVER to Justice Point with the following conditions:  (1) Defendant must reside with his mother; (2) Cooperate with any and all evaluations; (3) Must make all court appearnaces.  Court ordered case adjourned for return on the doctor's report to Branch 30, Judge Conen's court on July 20, 2016 at 8:30am.
Deputy Court Clerk tg

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Gregory A Renden appears in court with Defendant, Jason C. Jones.  Joanne L Hadtke appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Sheree J., mother of Defendant, appears in court.

Matter here for Doctor's Report Return.  The Court ordered Defendant into custody in Outpatient Treatment.  If not eligible, the Court needs to be contacted.

There being no challenges to the report from Dr. Robert Rawski by the State, defense or defendant, the Court finds that the defendant is incompetent to proceed at this time, but if provided with appropriate treatment, is likely to become competent within 12 months or within the maximum sentence specified for the most serious offense, whichever is less.  The proceedings are suspended.  The defendant is commited on August 11, 2015 to the Department of Health and Family Services for an indeterminate term not to exceed 12 months, or the maximum sentence specified for the most serious offense, whichever is less.  DHFS shall designate the mental health institute.  The sheriff shall transport the defendant to and from the designated institute.  The institute shall periodically re-examine the defendant and furnish written reports to the court 3 months, 6 months and 9 months after commitment, and 30 days prior to the expiration of the commitment.
Order of commitment for Treatment (Incompetency) signed and filed.

  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing. Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
